query: Read MEMORY.md and SOUL.md so they are available in the agent's context
expected_behavior: The memory_get tool reads MEMORY.md and returns its full contents
SOUL.md content is injected into the system prompt at context assembly time (not via tool call)
AGENTS.md is also injected into the system prompt alongside SOUL.md
USER.md is read and appended to the context with a clear section header
If MEMORY.md does not exist, the tool returns an empty string and creates the file gracefully
